channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-16634] LLAP Use a pool of connections to a single AM from a daemon
item.summary: LLAP Use a pool of connections to a single AM from a daemon

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch to fix this.

cc sershe for review.

Should the pool be capacity-restricted (I assume it cannot become larger than #of threads since only that many concurrent creation-s are possible, and no thread will ask for another UGI if it already has one, so perhaps not?). Should it be seeded with one UGI? Can be addressed on commit.
+1 pending tests

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12867399/HIVE-16634.01.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12867447 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Updated to add a cap. One downside is that it will always created the configured instances. Don't think seeding with a single instance helps a lot.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12867626 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Committing the .1 patch. I don't think the .2 patch test failures are related, but I don't like the patch too much. Will create a new jira to fix the pool size properly. Thanks for the review sershe
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
